CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 6, 1956, pg. A13, reads: "Star-Studded Years - Love of Beauty Brings Joy to Retirement - The Dandridges...Contentment among flowers." Portions of accompanying article read: "...One of the many contented retired citizens who turned away from daily toil two years ago...after 32 years in electrical department of Westinghouse's Air Brake Company, is Pittsburgh Pa.'s Nathaniel Dandridge...The terraced garden in the rear of the Dandridge home on Oakwood St. has lent itself well to the glowing flowers he has planted and raised...his pretty wife, Helen, the former Helen Hopson, born in Lynchburg, Va., and a Pittsburgher since she was six..."
TitMainTitle: Nathaniel Dandridge examining flower, and Helen Hopson Dandridge seated on bench with Look Magazine, in their yard on 500 block of Oakwood Street, Homewood, another version
